hedline.hl1: Ad Links Politics And Higher Gas Prices

abstract.p: Detroit Project Action Fund and Campaign for America's Future introduce TV commercial that blames politics for rising gasoline prices; ad argues that federal energy policy favors large oil companies over consumers (S)

block.p: The Detroit Project Action Fund, along with another group critical of current environmental policies, introduced a TV commercial yesterday that blames politics for rising gasoline prices.

The Detroit group drew wide attention last year for a campaign linking sport utility vehicles and terrorism, contending that some Middle East oil revenue, partly fed by gasoline demand in the United States, finds its way to terrorists.
The Detroit Project Action Fund, along with another group critical of current environmental policies, introduced a TV commercial yesterday that blames politics for rising gasoline prices.

The Detroit group drew wide attention last year for a campaign linking sport utility vehicles and terrorism, contending that some Middle East oil revenue, partly fed by gasoline demand in the United States, finds its way to terrorists.

The new 30-second spot, created by the fund and the Campaign for America's Future, argues that federal energy policy favors large oil companies over consumers. It shows a woman at a gasoline station noticing that, along with dials on the pump showing rapidly climbing prices, there are spinning dials measuring oil company profits, oil company contributions to the Bush administration and ''U.S. Tax Dollars Spent Defending Middle East Oil.''
The commercial began appearing yesterday in Los Angeles, New York and Washington.
